info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 6:36PM CDT until July 15 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Duluth MN
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...In Minnesota, Lake and St. Louis Counties.
* WHEN...Until 1130 PM CDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 635 PM CDT Tuesday, local law enforcement reported flooded roads in Silver Bay. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Two Harbors, Silver Bay, Beaver Bay, Thomas Lake Near Brimson, Highland Lake, Castle Danger, Gooseberry Falls State Park, Split Rock Lighthouse State Park, Split Rock Lighthouse, Brimson, Tettegouche State Park, Finland, Illgen City, Little Marais, George Manitou State Park, Island Lake, Alger, Wales and Pequaywan Lake. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and to the National Weather Service in Duluth when you can do so safely. Flooding can be reported to the National Weather Service at 1-800-685-8612.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT THIS EVENING
